alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 30 at 1:02PM CDT until June 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MDT /4 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Colorado, Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in Colorado, Cheyenne, Kit Carson and Yuma. In Kansas, Cheyenne, Decatur, Gove, Graham, Greeley, Logan, Norton, Rawlins, Sheridan, Sherman, Thomas, Wallace and Wichita. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock and Red Willow. * WHEN...From 3 PM MDT /4 PM CDT/ this afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong to severe storms are expected to develop across the Tri State area this afternoon, pushing east across the region into this evening. Rainfall rates in these storms could reach 1 to 2 inches an hour. This combined with saturated soils in many locales, and that storms could move slowly or even train, could produce flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
